oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Trials, litigation, etc.
Scopes, John Thomas; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpt of a video interview with Sue K. Hicks in which he gives his impressions of William Jennings Bryan.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Department of Conservation Motion Picture Films, 1930-1965
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sue K. Hicks, one of the members of the prosecuting team at the Scopes Trial, was interviewed by Peter Bowman, Professor of the History of Science at the University of Tennessee at Knoxville, for the 50th anniversary of the trial. Sue Hicks's brother, Herbert E. Hicks, was the acting Rhea County attorney at the time of the trial.
